page.title: 13Family life.
page.content: Most families in Glastonbury rely on their cars for transport in their everyday life. Many have to travel out of the town for work and shopping.The bus service,limited and expensive, is the only public transport. {St. John's Infants}and{St. Benedict's {Junior}schools provide for Primary Ed- ucation, whilst{St. Dunstan's}offers Comprehensive Education for 11 to 16 year olds. Those students who wish to continue their education must then transfer to the{Tertiary College}in Street. Certain courses are only offered at colleges in Taunton, Yeovil and Bridgwater. Glastonbury's slower pace of living attracts many elderly people who wish to spend their retirement in tranquil rural surroundings, away from the rush and tear of city life.
